org.rdkit.knime.nodes

Class AbstractRDKitNodeModel.ParallelProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • <any>
      • org.rdkit.knime.nodes.AbstractRDKitNodeModel.ParallelProcessor
  • Enclosing class:
    AbstractRDKitNodeModel

    public static class AbstractRDKitNodeModel.ParallelProcessor
extends <any>
    The ParallelProcessor implements a default configuration to use the the MultiThreadWorker for parallel processing. It uses a passed in factory to perform the computations of results and contains standard logic to handle results, to perform cancellation checks, to produce warnings or errors if something went wrong, to report progress, etc. Important is the ResultProcessor instance that must be passed in to the constructor. It will define the logic what to do with the results.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParallelProcessor

        public ParallelProcessor(AbstractRDKitCellFactory factory,
                         AbstractRDKitNodeModel.ResultProcessor resultProcessor,
                         long lRowCount,
                         WarningConsolidator warningConsolidator,
                         ExecutionContext exec)
        Creates a new parallel processor object to perform in several threads the work that is to do. Calculations (work) will be performed by the passed in factory implementation, which needs to be derived from the AbstractRDKitCellFactory (implement here the method process(...) ). After a thread has calculated new data cells the results will be passed to the passed in resultProcessor implementation. Here the method processResults(...) needs to be implemented. The last three parameters are involved in processing warnings and progress information and in checking, if the user cancelled the execution.
        Parameters:
        factory - The factory implementation to perform the calculations. Must not be null.
        resultProcessor - The result processor implementation, which could distribute the results to different tables, if desired. Must not be null.
        lRowCount - Row count of the input table in focus of this parallel processing. This value is used to determine the correct progress percentage.
        warningConsolidator - Warning consolidator to be used to save warning messages and its statistics (how often they occurred). Must not be null.
        exec - Execution context to check for user cancellation and to report progress. Must not be null.

      • ParallelProcessor

        public ParallelProcessor(AbstractRDKitCellFactory[] arrFactory,
                         AbstractRDKitNodeModel.ResultProcessor resultProcessor,
                         long lRowCount,
                         WarningConsolidator warningConsolidator,
                         ExecutionContext exec)
        Creates a new parallel processor object to perform in several threads the work that is to do. Calculations (work) will be performed by the passed in factory implementation, which needs to be derived from the AbstractRDKitCellFactory (implement here the method process(...) ). After a thread has calculated new data cells the results will be passed to the passed in resultProcessor implementation. Here the method processResults(...) needs to be implemented. The last three parameters are involved in processing warnings and progress information and in checking, if the user cancelled the execution.
        Parameters:
        arrFactory - Multiple factory implementations to perform the calculations. Must not be null.
        resultProcessor - The result processor implementation, which could distribute the results to different tables, if desired. Must not be null.
        lRowCount - Row count of the input table in focus of this parallel processing. This value is used to determine the correct progress percentage.
        warningConsolidator - Warning consolidator to be used to save warning messages and its statistics (how often they occurred). Must not be null.
        exec - Execution context to check for user cancellation and to report progress. Must not be null.

    • Method Detail

      • createColumnRearranger

        @Deprecated
protected ColumnRearranger createColumnRearranger(DataTableSpec inSpec,
                                                               AbstractRDKitCellFactory[] arrFactories,
                                                               java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<DataCell[]> blockingQueue,
                                                               ExecutionContext exec)
        Deprecated. This method is not used anymore and will be removed in the future.
        Creates a column rearranger, which works with this parallel processor. Note: Since KNIME 2.5.1 a factory will automatically process results using parallel threads, if a column rearranger is used and if the used factory allows for it.
        Parameters:
        inSpec - Specification of input table.
        arrFactories - Array of factories to be used to produce results cells based on an input row.
        blockingQueue - A blocking queue used to communicate between parallel processor and the column rearranger (getCells(...) method waits for results).
        exec - Execution context used for cancellation checks.
        Returns:
        Column rearranger that will pick up its results from the parallel processor.
        See Also:
        AbstractCellFactory#setParallelProcessing(boolean)

      • compute

        public DataCell[] compute(DataRow row,
                          long index)
        Computes new data cells based on an input row. The results of the input row must be independent of all other input rows due to the nature of multi-thread processing. This method calls the factory method getCells(row) to actually perform the concrete calculation work.
        Parameters:
        row - Input row from an input table.
        index - Index of the row. Not used in this implementation.

      • processFinished

        public void processFinished(ComputationTask task)
        Processes the finished calculated results from one of the threads of the parallel processing instance. It handles exceptions based on the factory's exception handling policy, checks for user cancellations and call the method processResults in Result Processor that was passed in to the constructor.
        Parameters:
        task - The computation task from the MultiThreadWorker. Must not be null.
